sessions.title: Demythifying AI: Understanding is all you need
sessions.description: Beyond the market panic and marketing hype and dreams of sentient AI lies the real world where AI has real utility, real applications, and real consequences. Join AI and emerging technology expert Morten Rand-Hendriksen for an exploration of what AI is, what it isn't, and how to reframe our thinking around these tools and materials to make them usable for us today and in the future. This is not a technical talk, but there will be technical examples.

sessions.title: How AI is Transforming Wellness & How You Can Too!
sessions.description:
A 15 minute motivational talk about how current advancements in generative AI are transforming the healthcare and wellness sector for the better and the worse (with examples!)
Then, we'll have 5 minutes to workshop new ideas and play around with them in Gemini
Finally, there will be 5 minutes for Q&A

sessions.title: Transforming Customer Experiences with Generative AI
sessions.description:
Objective: To explore how Generative AI can revolutionize customer service and engagement across industries.

Key Takeaways:
Generative AI enables personalized and efficient customer interactions, enhancing satisfaction and loyalty.

Implementing Generative AI in customer service can automate routine inquiries, allowing human agents to focus on complex issues.

Businesses must balance AI-driven personalization with data privacy and security to foster trust and compliance.

sessions.title: Intro to Open Source AI
sessions.description: It's a short crash course in AI with the purpose to demystify Large Language Models (LLMs) & Embeddings, using the new open source Llama 3 models.

sessions.title: AI in Healthcare: Unlocking New Possibilities
sessions.description: This presentation is a brief overview on how the power of artificial intelligence has helped revolutionize healthcare. As we navigate through this presentation, we'll delve into a list of the diverse applications of AI in healthcare settings, examining how these technologies are reshaping patient care and ultimately, saving lives. Join me as we embark on a journey to get a glimpse on ways how full potential of AI has been unlocked in healthcare

sessions.title: Using AI to verify English
sessions.description: How we built an Algorithm to predict English level.

sessions.title: AI Visibility Hacks:  From Incognito to Industry Icon - Become a Dream Job Magnet
sessions.description:
This session delves into the world of AI-powered job search strategies, specifically focusing on "AI Visibility Hacks."  Learn how to leverage cutting-edge AI tools, both standalone and integrated with LinkedIn, to transform your online presence and attract dream jobs.

Master the Art of Visibility:
The session unveils how to reverse engineer the job application process using AI to analyze and adapt to the hiring landscape. This empowers you to craft profiles and applications that stand out from the crowd.

AI Insights for Profile Optimization:
Discover how AI can unlock valuable insights for optimizing your online profiles. These insights will guide you in crafting compelling profiles that make you a beacon for dream job recruiters.

Expand Your Network Strategically:
This session explores how AI can help you expand your network with precision. By leveraging AI tools, you'll learn how to connect with the right people who can significantly impact your job search.

Unearth Hidden Opportunities with Intelligent Search:
Master cutting-edge search tactics powered by AI. This session equips you to uncover hidden job opportunities that perfectly align with your skills and aspirations.

This workshop is designed for those eager to leverage AI's full potential to become a magnet for dream jobs. Join and transform your approach to job hunting with the power of artificial intelligence!

sessions.title: Modulated Conversation I/O
sessions.description:
No one will buy your ChatGPT wrapper for idle conversation any more, no matter how RAG your are, it's 2024 already!
But how about making your chatbot more web2.0, doing CRUD through conversation?

sessions.title: Crossing Chasms: The Business World of AI Copilots
sessions.description:
Want to learn more about the real-world applications of AI and AI-enabled Copilots? 

Join Kasey Fu, Product Manager at Planview for Planview Copilot, as well as a co-founder of PM Hive, as he dives into the business applications and implications of AI Copilots!
Topics we'll explore:
- Why anyone can build a Copilot
- The business world of Copilots
- The challenge of finding proper use cases
- The future

sessions.title: Applied Gen AI - Lessons Learned
sessions.description:
This is a quick tour through projects I've launched in conjunction with a software consulting company in Vancouver over the last 6 months.  We'll go into technical detail and cover challenges from both a technical and business perspective.
Some themes:
 - information retrieval
 - intelligent agents
 - classifying unstructured data

sessions.title: Building AI Apps with Agentic Workflows
sessions.description: AI agents are everywhere. In this talk I will talk about how we can leverage agentic workflows to build deterministic AI applications.

sessions.title: Mastering Prompt Engineering
sessions.description:
I will begin by first introducing prompt engineering, best practices in order to optimize your prompt, using functions for APIs and finally current applications of prompt engineering which will take around 10 minutes.

Then, I will be hosting a competition based workshop where members are assigned into teams and they must work together to use Gemini prompt engineering to complete a task.

There will be a Q&A afterwards which will last for 5-10 minutes.

sessions.title: Detangling Site Speed Data: Core Web Vitals vs Lighthouse
sessions.description: A fast website is a must-have for delivering delightful UX, healthy conversion rates, strong SEO rank, and reduced CO2 emissions. Trouble is, there are a dozen ways to define "fast". In this talk we dig into which metrics matter, how to measure them, and where to begin a Web Performance Optimization project.

sessions.title: Building and Deploying AI Agents on Vertex AI for Real Life Application
sessions.description:
- Understand the power of functional calling
- Deploy AI Agents with LangChain

sessions.title: Cybersecurity and Privacy in AI for Developers
sessions.description: In the world of competitive innovations, adoption of AI is not a uncommon introduction anymore. Developers being a core part of AI based technologies building process are the front runner to keep security in AI development and implementation. This presentation is to define and use some key aspects of cybersecurity and privacy ideal to include in build lifecycle.

speakers.bio: Cher is the co-founder of Purple Lotus, providing equitable and personalized mental wellness plans for youth. She is also a 2023 Ai4Good Fellow and is currently researching Human-Computer Interactions at UBC.

Ilya is the CEO of VanHack, one of the world’s largest international tech recruitment companies. He studied economics and marketing at Cornell. Before founding VanHack, he worked in mining and created a crowdfunding app for the homeless. He loves swimming, hockey, and travel.

Kasey Fu is a current AI Product Manager at Planview for his company's flagship AI product, Planview Copilot. He's also a community co-founder of PM Hive, fiction author (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0BJZXKMM9), writer (monthly 700+ readers) in the AI and PM space, and avid traveller.
speakers.tagLine: AI Product Manager at Planview, Author, Writer, and Community Co-founder

speakers.bio: Software Engineer, Industrial, UX/UI Designer & Graphic Designer, CG Artist with 12 years professional experience. Always experimenting and building various projects to incorporating emerging technologies to deliver innovative user experiences.

Liam is a software engineer and architect who has recently been focused on applications of language models and generative AI.
He completed a Bachelor's degree in mathematics at the University of Victoria where he studied graph theory and algebra.

Introduction to Mohan Gulati

Current Role: Chief Executive Officer at thinkrr.ai
A seasoned AI Innovation Leader and Entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience in technology, product management, and agile software development.

Professional Journey
Managing Partner at Media.Monks: Led the tech pillar of Media.Monks, one of the largest advertising agencies worldwide, driving impactful and human-centric tech solutions for Fortune 500 companies.
Experience with Fortune 500 Companies: Conducted internal presentations and workshops for leading global corporations including Starbucks, BMW, First American, Wunderkind, CIBC, Blackberry, and Nokia, showcasing a strong track record of delivering value through technology.
Political Moderator: Demonstrated exceptional communication skills and the ability to engage diverse audiences by serving as a Political Moderator for Public Debates, further highlighting versatility and leadership in various settings.

Expertise and Achievements
AI and Emerging Technologies: Deep expertise in AI, data, sustainability, and product leadership. A proven leader in driving technology-driven business transformations across various industries and geographies.
Patent Holder: Inventor with a patent for a method and system for defining a selection range for a variable speed device, showcasing innovation and technical proficiency.
Keynote Speaker: Recognized as a keynote speaker on AI, sharing insights on business innovation, success cases, trends, and practical business models and practices at industry conferences and events.

Personal Highlights
Global Leadership Experience: Successfully led and managed diverse teams across multiple continents, including Columbia, India, Europe, and North America. This experience has honed my ability to navigate cultural differences and foster cohesive, high-performing teams in a global context.
International Living: Lived in Vienna, Austria, for 8 years, immersing myself in the local culture and gaining a deep understanding of European business practices and social norms.
Multilingual Proficiency: Fluent in German, Hindi, and English, enabling effective communication and relationship-building with teams, clients, and stakeholders from various linguistic backgrounds.

Morten is a developer, designer, educator, and philosopher specializing in web standards, interaction design, and technology ethics.  He has made hundreds of courses for Lynda.com and LinkedIn Learning covering design, web standards, bleeding edge technologies, and ethics, and is a popular speaker at major conferences around the globe. You may have learned WordPress, or JavaScript, or CSS grid from him, or seen him talking about surveillance capitalism and AI on TikTok. In his spare time he builds Lego space ships with his 6 year old son and dances ballroom with his wife.

Nikhil Banaal is currently working with Mastercard Cyber Intelligence Business Unit as Portfolio Security Consultant and provide guidance for cybersecurity standards guidance to stakeholders in design, development and implementation of software product lifecycle.
speakers.tagLine: Nikhil Banaal, CCSP, CRISC - Mastercard Technologies Canada ULC

speakers.bio: I am a die hard developer fused with the entrepreneurial spirit. As cloud evangelist at heart, I love anything to do with serverless.

Hey, I'm Qingyue(Annie) Wang, a software engineer with over five years of industry experience, including roles at Amazon and Google. As an internal career coach for the past year, I've trained new hires, fostering leadership and career progression. I am a certified career coach with over 200 coaching hours.

My passion lies in the human side of tech, offering mentorship and support to fellow developers. Beyond coding, I'm into unleashing creativity through photoshoots and music. Excited to connect, learn, and grow together at DevFest.
speakers.tagLine: Software Engineer and Internal Career Coach at Google

speakers.bio:
The Engineer who had his demo turned into a project for dozens of engineers in a startup.
Currently leading the AI research on realtime interactive digital avatar. Mostly focus on video/ image generation.
Some Kaggle medals like those matter.
Built many handy pypi libraries, sadly not much people knows.
Done all above with a business bachelor degree, and heavy dose of fast.ai

Meet Samichi Saluja, a person of unique journey and boundless curiosity. Starting her career with a knack for coding post her BTech, she soon found her true calling in the realm of marketing and decided to dive in headfirst after earning her MBA.

As she stepped into the marketing domain, she quickly became the person to turn to for brand storytelling, advertising, and strategic planning across different high-growth industries. Her roles at Vodafone Idea Ltd and The Walt Disney Company weren't just jobs—they were platforms where she connected brands with audiences in a way that made a real difference.

Her adventure continued at QYou Media Inc, where, as an Assistant Vice President, she launched their TV channel, bringing a whole new level of engagement to the brand.

And Samichi doesn't stop at what's known. She's been exploring and dissecting AI tools, but from a consumer perspective, always keen on finding fresh, new ways to connect with audiences.

Now based in Burnaby, BC, Samichi is all about helping brands share their stories in the most relatable way. Her upcoming session, "Look, Who's Buying? Beyond Persona Playbook," is not just a presentation—it’s a fun yet insightful dive into the world of marketing personas, offering everyone a new way to look at the market.
speakers.tagLine: Samichi Saluja, Brand Alchemist: Weaving Insights into Growth Narratives

speakers.bio:
With over 15 years of building the web - from bare metal to branding - Shawn obsesses over eliminating the micro-friction that causes us all to abandon our digital journeys - slow site speed. 
At SpeedSense he and his team help top-tier consumer brands lift revenue, traffic, and conversion, all through running a faster website.

BCIT graduate specialized in 'Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning'. Previously worked as a Data Engineer at ICBC, Lead Backend Developer for TerraTap Technologies and was President of Coding for All club.
speakers.tagLine: BCIT Graduate | Prev Lead Developer @ TerraTap Technologies | Prev Data Engineer @ ICBC

speakers.bio: An experienced senior leader in healthcare, I am known to be at the forefront of innovation, transformation, and strategy. Also have a passion for empowering individuals to navigate career transitions and excel in high-stakes interviews.
speakers.tagLine: Problem Solver, Advisor, Innovation Strategist & Digital Transformation Enthusiast.

speakers.bio: I'm a programmer and corporate consultant who's worked in Silicon Valley for ten years. I started working on OS kernels and moved to enterprise software. Later, I joined Google Assistant, where I got into NLP. I helped found Google Contact Center AI and later did a related startup. One failed startup later, I'm heading back to be a founding engineer to recapitalize myself a little.
